overview: This is an advanced language subject for Honours students in Arabic. The level of study, content, and assessment in the subject will be determined by the Coordinator after placement testing. Based on the outcome of testing, students will either be placed in an appropriate stream of advanced language study or a customized course of study will be available, focusing on research skills in Arabic.
intended learning outcomes: Have further developed their Arabic language abilities, focusing on research skills necessary for thesis writing
Gain a greater appreciation of textual styles and discourse as related to their area of interest in Arabic Studies
Develop a deeper understanding of intellectual debates that have arisen on key topics in Arabic language and/or culture research.

assessments.description: An argumentative or evaluative essay. 1000 words

Hurdle requirement:. Class attendance is required for this subject; if you do not attend a minimum of 80% of classes without an approved exemption you will not be eligible for a pass in this subject. All pieces of written work must be submitted to pass this subject.

Semester 1.Contact hours: A total of 24 to 48 hours: Two to four hours per week (depending on outcome of placement test)

Prescribed texts: Please consult the subject LMS site or the subject coordinator.
